Adopt the Blue: The diver-led push

to protect the ocean

Only 8% of the world’s oceans are protected—well short of the 30% target for 2030. Adopt the Blue aims to change this by developing the world’s largest network of underwater sites for ocean conservation. Led by

PADI and Blancpain, the initiative empowers divers worldwide to collect data on coral health, marine species and ocean debris through a new conservation portal that streamlines submissions across citizen science programmes. The goal: to expand marine protection and enable smarter ocean policy. Blancpain, creator of the first true diver’s watch in 1953, has backed marine research and exploration for over two decades through its Blancpain Ocean Commitment.
